pkgmetadata.longdescription: Ecological Inference by Linear Programming under Homogeneity // Provides a bunch of algorithms based on linear programming for estimating, under the homogeneity hypothesis, RxC ecological contingency tables (or vote transition matrices) using mainly aggregate data (from voting units). References: Pava and Romero (2024) doi:10.1177/00491241221092725. Pava and Romero (2024) doi:10.1093/jrsssa/qnae013. Pava (2023) doi:10.1007/s43545-023-00658-y. Pava (2024) doi:10.1080/0022250X.2024.2423943. Pava (2024) doi:10.1177/07591063241277064. Pava and Penads (2024). A bottom-up approach for ecological inference. Romero, Pava, Martn and Romero (2020) doi:10.1080/02664763.2020.1804842.
